message:
i'm normally a js dev & using sublime & the other new ides.  
will i gain anything if i learn vim or emacs or spacemacs ?
& what's the advantages exactly ? 
& if that the case which one do you recommend ?

data.message:
No vim and emacs are just for usage inside command line usually for quick edits by SSH
Invest your time in learning something else
I suggest Jetbrains WebStorm. It's based on the popular IDE IntellijIDEA (the base of Android Studio), with built in command line, refactoring, source control integtation, and much more
generally less mouse and more keyboard is more productive on the long run, but not necessarily enjoyable to everyone.
I enjoyed Emacs when I learned it, because of just using the keyboard and it's awesome responsiveness. It would be also good if I installed Ubuntu on a VM and didn't need the GUI.

يااااه ال vim كتبت بية shall script من سنة بس اعتقد ان مفيش مبرمج يهمة الوقت هيركز فى انة يفتح كومند لين ويكتب حتى لو الشورت كات بتسهل بس احنا حتى فى sublime بنزل بلجنز عشان تخلينة ننجز فمش معقول هكتب كل حرف واعمل debugging لاسم فانكشن فيها حرف كابتل :)

Vim and emacs are good for troubleshooting development when u ssh the server

هو الموضوع ببساطة إن محدش يقدر يحكم على vim او emacs الا اللي جربهم. مينفعش واحد كل تعامله مع vim و هو مSSH على سيرفر يقولك إتعلمه أو لا. لأن الفايدة اللي بتاخدها من vim أو emacs بتاخد فترة على ما تحس بيها. فا بصراحة كل الناس اللي بتعمم و تقولك ميستخدمش غير في كذا و هما مجربوش دول أنا مثقش في رأيهم. لإن لا فيه ناس كتير بتستخدم vim/emacs و عايشه و productive و في رأيي (اللي ممكن يكون غلط) أكتر من لما كانت بتستعمل حاجة تانية. أه طبيعي يبقى فيه إختلاف في الآراء بس تدخل في النقاش ده مع واحد جرب النوعين و إختار حاجة فيهم.

to sum it up , vim has a very steep learning curve to be honest, but once you master it , it "can" help you more to be more productive , because navigation with keyboard is quite faster than using the mouse , it has quite big set of commands ,to give you one example for how can it help u be more productive , u can clear a whole line with clicking "dd" instead of selecting the entire line with the mouse and then clicking the backspace button , just give it a try

I only learn Emacs for "fun" really, it is cool and extinsible, but for JS development, webstorm or sublime are just as good. The saying goes "Linux is the library Emacs uses to connect to the hardware" :)

P.S. reading the other comments, even if you "master" Emacs which could be a 5 year job, by then JS could be obselete, and the productivity you gain by programming using just the keyboard is negligible, and you can also do the same in sublime or webstorm

Ok guys. Thank u all very very much. 
Now I have my answer.
 
I came to the conclusion that i really don't need vim & it's brothers except for specific scenarios.
